marketNews.title: IMF Outlook Update Lifts Global and Indonesian Growth Projections
marketNews.content: The IMF in its latest July 2025 outlook increased the projection for global economic growth in 2025 and 2026 to +3% YoY and +3.1% YoY, respectively, compared to the projection that was downgraded in April 2025 at the +2.8% YoY and +3% YoY levels. This projection increase is based on stronger than expected purchases ahead of the August 1, 2025 tariff deadline, as well as tariff reductions by the US for a number of key trading partners. The IMF also increased the projection for Indonesia's economic growth in 2025 and 2026 to +4.8% YoY from the projection downgraded in April 2025 at the +4.7% YoY level.

marketNews.title: US President Trump Announces 25% Tariff on Indian Goods Starting August 1, 2025
marketNews.content: US President Donald Trump said on Wednesday (30/5) that the US will impose a 25% tariff on goods originating from India starting August 1, 2025, slightly lower than the announcement in April 2025 at 26% and higher compared to the new agreement with Indonesia at the 19% level. Trump added that the US will also impose additional sanctions on India related to energy purchases from Russia.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Coal Demand from Smelters Expected to Peak in 2026 Before Declining
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that the Indonesian Coal Miners Association (APBI) estimates coal demand from the smelter industry will peak at 84.2 million tons in 2026, before declining to 78.6 million tons in 2027. This projected decline in demand is based on overcapacity in the nickel sector and the potential implementation of stricter emission regulations. News regarding the prospect of slowing coal demand from the smelter industry emerges amid a contraction in Indonesian coal export volume by -12.6% YoY during 1H25, according to data from Kpler. The smelter industry in Indonesia itself - which mostly processes nickel - is one of the sources of Indonesian coal demand. According to Global Energy Monitor, the nickel smelter industry has pushed captive power plant capacity in Indonesia from 5.5 GW in 2019 to 16.6 GW in 2024.

marketNews.title: US Commerce Secretary announces 0% Tariffs on certain Natural Resources for Partner Countries
marketNews.content: US Commerce Secretary, Howard Lutnick, said on Tuesday (29/7) that President Donald Trump has agreed to impose a 0% tariff on natural resources not produced by the US, such as coffee and cocoa. This tariff elimination will apply to countries that already have trade agreements with the US, including the European Union and Indonesia.

marketNews.title: PPATK Will Continue Blocking Dormant Savings Accounts to Protect Citizens from Crime
marketNews.content: The Head of the Financial Transaction Reports and Analysis Center (PPATK), Ivan Yustiavandana, on Tuesday (29/7) confirmed that the blocking of savings accounts classified as dormant or inactive for a certain period will continue. This policy is claimed to protect citizens from criminal acts, such as online gambling.

marketNews.title: United Tractors is Reviewing Komatsu Heavy Equipment Sales Projection Following 1H25 Carry-over Impact
marketNews.content: The Corporate Secretary of United Tractors, Sara K. Loebis, said that the company is still reviewing the projection for Komatsu heavy equipment sales until the end of 2025. Although Komatsu sales reached 2,728 units during 1H25 (+27.1% YoY) and have reached 59% of the 2025 target of 4,600 units, Sara explained that this realization was influenced by the carry over of deliveries that were delayed at the end of 2024.

marketNews.title: Astra International Increases Ownership in Medikaloka Hermina
marketNews.content: Astra International's ownership in Medikaloka Hermina increased by 65.3 million (0.42%) shares, based on KSEI data as of July 28, 2025. The transaction value is unknown. This transaction raised ASII's ownership portion in HEAL from 7.23% to 7.65%.

tickerNews.title: BBCA 1H25: Net Profit +8% YoY, Lifts CoC Guidance
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia (BBCA) recorded a net profit of 14.9 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (+6% YoY, +5% QoQ). This result brings the net profit for 1H25 to 29 trillion rupiah (+8% YoY), in line with expectations (50% of 2025F consensus estimate vs. 1H24: 49% realization in 2024). Generally, performance in 2Q25 and 1H25 is not much different from 1Q25 performance, but with greater attention to credit quality aspects.

tickerNews.title: Net Profit Driven by Solid PPOP (+8/+9% YoY) in 2Q25/1H25
tickerNews.content: Net Interest Income (NII) grew +6%/+7% YoY in 2Q25/1H25, supported by credit growth of +13% YoY as of June 2025 (vs. March 2025: +13% YoY). BBCA management still maintains a credit growth guidance in the range of +6-8% YoY for 2025, considering the realization of credit growth during 1H25 was driven by a surge in short-term money market loans and a more cautious stance. Non-Interest Income (Non-II) grew solidly +13%/+11% YoY in 2Q25/1H25, with operating expense growth kept under control at +8%/+5% YoY.

tickerNews.title: Asset Quality Declines, CoC Guidance Rises from 0.3% to 0.3-0.5%
tickerNews.content: Provision expenses in 2Q25/1H25 surged +81%/+43% YoY, causing the Cost of Credit (CoC) as of 1H25 to reach 0.5% (vs. 1H24: 0.3%). BBCA management stated that this provision addition is a proactive step by the company in facing a situation that still contains much uncertainty. Gross NPL increased again to 2.2% in 2Q25 (vs. 1Q25: 2%, 4Q24: 1.8%). Segmentally, asset quality deterioration occurred in the 'SME' and 'Consumer' segments. Therefore, BBCA sees credit growth from these two segments potentially continuing to slow down in 2H25. For 1H25 itself, the 'SME' and 'Consumer' segments experienced credit growth of +11% YoY and +8% YoY, respectively.

tickerNews.title: Key Takeaway for BBCA
tickerNews.content: Although expecting acceleration in government spending and lower interest rates to boost the economy - and ultimately credit growth and Third Party Funds (especially CASA) - in 2H25, BBCA management maintained its credit growth guidance while raising the CoC guidance as a proactive and cautious step.

tickerNews.title: ASII 1H25: Net Profit -2% YoY, Relatively Weak Operations
tickerNews.content: Astra International (ASII) recorded a net profit of 8.6 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (+2% YoY, +24% QoQ). This result brings the net profit for 1H25 to 15.5 trillion rupiah (-2% YoY), equivalent to 49% of the 2025F consensus estimate. The net profit in 2Q25 was boosted by non-operating income and foreign exchange gains, which combined reached 1.5 trillion rupiah/1.6 trillion rupiah in 2Q25/1H25 (vs. 2Q24/1H24: 208 billion rupiah/346 billion rupiah). Operationally, operating profit decreased by -7%/-8% YoY in 2Q25/1H25, with the realization of operating profit during 1H25 in line with expectations (48% of 2025F consensus estimate vs. 1H24: 49% realization in 2024). Segmentally, net profit from the 'Financial Services' (+6% YoY), 'Agribusiness' (+40% YoY), and 'Infrastructure' (+38% YoY) segments supported ASII's performance during 1H25, while the 'Auto' (-8% YoY) and 'Heavy Equipment & Mining' (-15% YoY) segments experienced a decline. Astra International (ASII) ownership in Medikaloka Hermina (HEAL) increased by 65.3 million (0.42%) shares, based on KSEI data as of July 28, 2025. The transaction value is unknown. This transaction raised ASII's ownership portion in HEAL from 7.23% to 7.65%.

tickerNews.title: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua and Bangun Kosambi Sukses Announce 1H25 Financial Reports Will Be Audited
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua (PANI) and its subsidiary, Bangun Kosambi Sukses (CBDK), announced that their respective 1H25 financial reports will be audited. Thus, the two issuers will submit their 1H25 financial reports no later than September 30, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ISAT 1H25 Net Profit Below Expectation, Revises EBITDA Guidance Downwards
tickerNews.content: Indosat (ISAT) recorded a net profit of approximately 1 trillion rupiah in 2Q25 (-29% YoY, -22% QoQ). This result brings the net profit for 1H25 to 2.3 trillion rupiah (-15% YoY), below expectations (42% of 2025F consensus estimate). Operationally, operating profit during 1H25 decreased by -14% YoY to approximately 4.9 trillion rupiah, below the consensus estimate (42% of 2025F consensus), due to a revenue decrease (-3% YoY) and an increase in cost of revenue (+3% YoY). EBITDA during 1H25 also fell by -4% YoY to 12.9 trillion rupiah, leading management to revise the 2025 EBITDA growth guidance to low single-digit, compared to the initial target of growth exceeding +10%. Average revenue per user (ARPU) for the 'Mobile' segment in 2Q25 stabilized at 38.5 thousand rupiah (+0% YoY, -2% QoQ), but subscriber numbers decreased to 95.4 million (-5% YoY, +0% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: MYOR 1H25 Net Profit Down 32% YoY, Gross Profit Margin Weakens
tickerNews.content: Mayora Indah (MYOR) recorded a net profit of 477 billion rupiah (-21% YoY, -31% QoQ). This result brings the net profit for 1H25 to 1.17 trillion rupiah (-32% YoY), below expectations (38% of 2025F consensus estimate vs. 3-year average: 43% annual realization). The decline in net profit during 1H25 was primarily caused by a decrease in gross profit margin to 21.2% (vs. 1H24: 25.8%). Revenue itself grew +10% YoY during 1H25, but with weaker growth in 2Q25 at +6% YoY. MYOR will hold its 2Q25 earnings call on Friday (1/8).

tickerNews.title: HMSP 1H25 Net Profit Down 36% YoY Due to One-off Tax Burden, Operational Growth Intact
tickerNews.content: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna (HMSP) recorded a net profit of 210 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (-80% YoY, -89% QoQ). This result brings the net profit for 1H25 to only 2.1 trillion rupiah (-36% YoY), below expectations (28% of 2025F consensus estimate). The net profit performance was suppressed by a one-off tax expense in 2Q25 following an adjustment for previous periods' taxes. Operationally, gross profit and operating profit still grew by +18% YoY and +41% YoY, respectively, in 2Q25, so that during 1H25 they grew by +11% YoY and +8% YoY. In our view, the increase in gross profit margin and operating profit margin is partly supported by the absence of excise duty increases this year. On the top-line, revenue still weakened by -4.6% YoY during 1H25, pressured by declines in average selling price and sales volume by -3.1% YoY and -1.5% YoY, respectively.

tickerNews.title: CDIA Directors Substantially Increase Share Ownership
tickerNews.content: Two directors of Chandra Daya Investasi (CDIA), Merly and Agus Lukmanul Hakim, respectively purchased 4 million shares and 1.5 million shares of CDIA at an average price of 1,290 rupiah per share on July 24-25, 2025. The total transaction value for both reached approximately 7 billion rupiah. Following these transactions, the direct ownership of Merly and Agus Lukmanul Hakim in CDIA increased from none to 0.003% and 0.001%, respectively.

tickerNews.title: DEWA Secures Rp 350 Billion Syndicated Credit Facility from BBCA and OK Bank
tickerNews.content: Darma Henwa (DEWA) obtained a syndicated credit facility for working capital amounting to 350 billion rupiah from Bank Central Asia (BBCA) and OK Bank, with an option to increase the commitment up to 500 billion rupiah. This 2-year tenor facility has an interest rate of 8.3% per year.
